style it's charming witty fun and
inviting but how does the gameplay hold
up let's take a look
at first glance people thought banjo
kazooie was just a super mario 64 ripoff
but that's disingenuous 3d platformers
are a genre like any other
it's like saying halo combat Evolved was
a ripoff of aliens not on that banjo
kazooie is one of those games that is
pure fun it doesn't fall into any
pitfalls that other genres and
franchises might you don't have
excessive tutorials or unskipable
15-minute cutscenes no obnoxious
technical problems ridiculous difficulty
spikes oh hey you know tedious grinding
none of that garbage you get dropped
into the toriel now you can take the
five to ten minutes to explore spiral
mountain and you really should to get
those empty honeycombs but you can just
as easily skip it all and head straight
into the action when you do you find
that the gameplay offers the best type
of fun how do you build a game around a
concept as simple as walking into items
and make that enjoyable by having
expansive open worlds that are begging
you to explore them with so many nooks
and crannies to explore by having the
music notes spin around and the eggs
bounce up and down these little
animations give life and character to
the game and it's collectibles you make
it enjoyable by rewarding players when
they collect enough items by opening up
new areas there's tons of ways to make
collectathon like this fun and banjo
kazooie hits every stride does a
perfectly balanced job of that unlike
some of its contemporaries like Donkey
Kong 64 which had just swapped between
five characters in backtracks 17 million
times for the sequel which had some
ridiculously complex jiggies and tons of
backtracking as well even super mario 64
to a greater extent you don't have to
exit the world each time you grab a
jiggy the game is hella fun because of
the simplistic thrills grabbing a jiggy
and watching the two bounce up and down
they're happy about collecting things
and by proxy so are you you're always on
the lookout for special items like mumbo
tokens jinjos and occasionally extra
lies now you're starting move set is

controls would still feel really good on
the Nintendo 64 controller when a game

if you make a mistake in banjo kazooie
it's your own damn fault there ain't

banjo-kazooie never feels repetitive for
a single moment the platforming is

only serve to stretch it out to give the

lost frustrated or impatient with this
game and that's real important
challenging you but not frustrating you
every location has its own unique
